alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 25 at 2:39PM AKST until January 26 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...The Southern Inner Channels, Prince of Wales Island, Baranof Island, and portions of the central Inner Channels including Ketchikan, Sitka, Petersburg, Wrangell, Craig, Angoon, Metlakatla, Kake, Klawock, Hydaburg, Thorne Bay, Coffman Cove, Port Alexander, Point Baker, Port Protection, Edna Bay, Naukati Bay, Whale Pass, Hyder, Saxman, and Meyers Chuck. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Aviation and marine travel could also be impacted at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread fog will develop Tuesday evening and will become dense at times locally. The threat of dense fog persists into Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
